&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company adopted FSP 106-2 in the third quarter of 2004. The impact for 2006, 2005 and 2004 was a reduction of pre-tax net postretirement health care costs and
an increase in net earnings. The amounts in the table above reflect the following benefits: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In 2007, the discount rate used to determine the Company's net postretirement cost will be 5.90% for its U.S. plans and 5.00% for its Canadian plans, and the
health care cost trend rate will be 8.00% for its U.S. plans and 8.50% for its Canadian plans. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The current portion of the Company's accrued postretirement health care costs of $216&nbsp;million and $208&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2006 and 2005,
respectively, is included in other accrued liabilities on the consolidated balance sheets. </FONT></P>

<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>$</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>237</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>$</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>139</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>$</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>167</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=2><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=2 ALIGN="RIGHT"><HR NOSHADE SIZE=4></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=2 ALIGN="RIGHT"><HR NOSHADE SIZE=4></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As previously discussed in Note&nbsp;3. </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Asset Impairment, Exit and Implementation Costs</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the Company announced
several workforce reduction programs during 2006, 2005 and 2004, as part of the overall restructuring program. The cost of these programs, $247&nbsp;million, $139&nbsp;million and
$167&nbsp;million in 2006, 2005 and 2004, respectively, is included in other expense, above. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
estimated net gain for the postemployment benefit plans that will be amortized from accumulated other comprehensive income into net postemployment costs during 2007 is
$7&nbsp;million. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>90</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The accumulated benefit obligation was determined using a discount rate of 6.3% in 2006, an assumed ultimate annual turnover rate of 0.3% in 2006 and 2005,
assumed compensation cost increases of 4.0% in 2006 and 2005, and assumed benefits as defined in the respective plans.
Postemployment costs arising from actions that offer employees benefits in excess of those specified in the respective plans are charged to expense when incurred. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>91</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Note&nbsp;17.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Financial Instruments:  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Derivative financial instruments:  </I></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company operates globally, with manufacturing and sales facilities in various locations around the world, and utilizes certain financial instruments to manage
its foreign currency and commodity
exposures. Derivative financial instruments are used by the Company, principally to reduce exposures to market risks resulting from fluctuations in foreign exchange rates and commodity prices by
creating offsetting exposures. The Company is not a party to leveraged derivatives and, by policy, does not use financial instruments for speculative purposes. Financial instruments qualifying for
hedge accounting must maintain a specified level of effectiveness between the hedging instrument and the item being hedged, both at inception and throughout the hedged period. The Company formally
documents the nature of and relationships between the hedging instruments and hedged items, as well as its risk-management objectives, strategies for undertaking the various hedge
transactions and method of assessing hedge effectiveness. Additionally, for hedges of forecasted transactions, the significant characteristics and expected terms of the forecasted transaction must be
specifically identified, and it must be probable that each forecasted transaction will occur. If it were deemed probable that the forecasted transaction will not occur, the gain or loss would be
recognized in earnings currently. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Company uses forward foreign exchange contracts and foreign currency options to mitigate its exposure to changes in exchange rates from third-party and intercompany actual and
forecasted transactions. Substantially all of the Company's derivative financial instruments are effective as hedges. The primary currencies to which the Company is exposed, based on the size and
location of its businesses, include the euro, Swiss franc, British pound and Canadian dollar. At December&nbsp;31, 2006 and 2005, the Company had foreign exchange option and forward contracts with
aggregate notional amounts of $2.6&nbsp;billion and $2.2&nbsp;billion, respectively. The effective portion of unrealized gains and losses associated with forward and option contracts is deferred
as a component of accumulated other comprehensive earnings (losses) until the underlying hedged transactions are reported on the Company's consolidated statement of earnings. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Company is exposed to price risk related to forecasted purchases of certain commodities used as raw materials by its businesses. Accordingly, the Company uses commodity forward
contracts as cash flow hedges, primarily for coffee, milk, sugar and cocoa. In general, commodity forward contracts qualify for the normal purchase exception under SFAS No.&nbsp;133 and are,
therefore, not subject to the provisions of SFAS No.&nbsp;133. In addition, commodity futures and options are also used to hedge the price of certain commodities, including milk, coffee, cocoa,
wheat, corn, sugar, soybean oil, natural gas and heating oil. For qualifying contracts, the effective portion of unrealized gains and losses on commodity futures and option contracts is deferred as a
component of accumulated other comprehensive earnings (losses) and is recognized as a component of cost of sales in the Company's consolidated statement of earnings when the related inventory is sold.
Unrealized gains or losses on net commodity positions were </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>92</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=93,EFW="2176027",CP="KRAFT FOODS INC",DN="1",CHK=381993,FOLIO='92',FILE='DISK124:[07ZAA5.07ZAA4185]EI4185A.;36',USER='FSTREET',CD='28-FEB-2007;19:25' -->
<A NAME="page_ei4185_1_93"> </A>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>immaterial
at December&nbsp;31, 2006 and 2005. At December&nbsp;31, 2006 and 2005, the Company had net long commodity positions of $533&nbsp;million and $521&nbsp;million, respectively. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Ineffectiveness
related to cash flow hedges was not material for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, 2005 and 2004. At December&nbsp;31, 2006, the Company was hedging forecasted
transactions for periods not exceeding the next fifteen months, and expects substantially all amounts reported in
accumulated other comprehensive earnings (losses) to be reclassified to the consolidated statement of earnings within the next twelve months. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Derivative
gains or losses reported in accumulated other comprehensive earnings (losses) are a result of qualifying hedging activity. Transfers of gains or losses from accumulated other
comprehensive earnings (losses) to earnings are offset by corresponding gains or losses on the underlying hedged item. Hedging activity affected accumulated other comprehensive earnings (losses), net
of income taxes, during the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, 2005 and 2004, as follows (in millions): </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Credit exposure and credit risk:  </I></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company is exposed to credit loss in the event of nonperformance by counterparties. However, the Company does not anticipate nonperformance, and such exposure
was not material at December&nbsp;31, 2006. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Fair value:  </I></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The aggregate fair value, based on market quotes, of the Company's third-party debt at December&nbsp;31, 2006, was $10,421&nbsp;million as compared with its
carrying value of $10,214&nbsp;million. The aggregate fair value of the Company's third-party debt at December&nbsp;31, 2005, was $10,750&nbsp;million as compared with its carrying value of
$10,548&nbsp;million. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
September&nbsp;2006, the FASB issued SFAS No.&nbsp;157 "Fair Value Measurements," which will be effective for financial statements issued for fiscal years beginning after
November&nbsp;15, 2007. This statement defines fair value, establishes a framework for measuring fair value and expands disclosures about fair value measurements. The adoption of this statement will
not have a material impact on the Company's financial statements. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;See
Notes&nbsp;4, 8 and 9 for additional disclosures of fair value for short-term borrowings and long-term debt. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Note&nbsp;18.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Contingencies:  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Kraft and its subsidiaries are parties to a variety of legal proceedings arising out of the normal course of business, including a few cases in which substantial
amounts of damages are sought. While the results of litigation cannot be predicted with certainty, management believes that the final outcome of these proceedings will not have a material adverse
effect on the Company's consolidated financial position, results of operations or cash flows. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>93</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=94,EFW="2176027",CP="KRAFT FOODS INC",DN="1",CHK=902494,FOLIO='93',FILE='DISK124:[07ZAA5.07ZAA4185]EI4185A.;36',USER='FSTREET',CD='28-FEB-2007;19:25' -->
<A NAME="page_ei4185_1_94"> </A>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Third-Party Guarantees:  </I></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At December&nbsp;31, 2006, the Company's third-party guarantees, which are primarily derived from acquisition and divestiture activities, approximated
$21&nbsp;million, of which $8&nbsp;million have no specified expiration dates. Substantially all of the remainder expire through 2016, with no guarantees expiring during 2007. The Company is
required to perform under these guarantees in the event that a third party fails to make contractual payments or achieve performance measures. The Company has a
liability of $16&nbsp;million on its consolidated balance sheet at December&nbsp;31, 2006, relating to these guarantees. </FONT></P>

not agree to the total for the year.  </I></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As discussed in Note&nbsp;13. </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Income Taxes</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the Company has recognized income tax benefits in the consolidated
statements of earnings during 2006 and 2005 as a result of various tax events, including a reimbursement from Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc. in cash for unrequired federal tax reserves and net state tax
reversals due to the conclusion of an audit of Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc.'s consolidated federal income tax returns for the years 1996 through 1999, and benefits earned under the provisions of the
American Jobs Creation Act. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Note&nbsp;20.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Subsequent Event:  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On January&nbsp;31, 2007, the Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc. Board of Directors announced that Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc. plans to spin off all of its remaining
interest (89.0%) in the Company on a pro rata basis to Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc. stockholders in a tax-free transaction. The distribution of all the Kraft shares owned by Altria
Group,&nbsp;Inc. will be made on March&nbsp;30, 2007 ("Distribution Date"), to Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc. stockholders of record as of the close of business on March&nbsp;16, 2007. Based on the
number of shares of Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc. outstanding at December&nbsp;31, 2006, the distribution ratio would be approximately 0.7 shares of Kraft Class&nbsp;A common stock for every share of
Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc. common stock outstanding. Prior to the distribution, Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc. will convert its Class&nbsp;B shares of Kraft common stock, which carry ten votes per share,
into Class&nbsp;A shares of Kraft, which carry one vote per share. Following the distribution, only Class&nbsp;A common shares of Kraft will be outstanding and Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc. will not
own any shares of Kraft. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Stock Compensation:  </I></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Holders of Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc. stock options will be treated as stockholders and will, accordingly, have their stock awards split into two instruments.
Holders of Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc. stock options will receive the following stock options, which, immediately after the spin-off, will have an aggregate intrinsic value equal to the
intrinsic value of the pre-spin Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc. options: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>a
new Kraft option to acquire the number of shares of Kraft Class&nbsp;A common stock equal to the product of (a)&nbsp;the number of Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc. options
held by such person on the Distribution Date and (b)&nbsp;the approximate distribution ratio of 0.7 mentioned above; and </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>96</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=8,SEQ=97,EFW="2176027",CP="KRAFT FOODS INC",DN="1",CHK=725912,FOLIO='96',FILE='DISK124:[07ZAA5.07ZAA4185]EI4185A.;36',USER='FSTREET',CD='28-FEB-2007;19:25' -->
<A NAME="page_ei4185_1_97"> </A>
<UL>
<UL>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>an
adjusted Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc. option for the same number of shares of Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc. common stock with a reduced exercise price. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Holders
of Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc. restricted stock or stock rights awarded prior to January&nbsp;31, 2007, will retain their existing award and will receive restricted stock or
stock rights of Kraft Class&nbsp;A common stock. The amount of Kraft restricted stock or stock rights awarded to such holders will be calculated using the same formula set forth above with respect
to new Kraft options. All of the restricted stock and stock rights will not vest until the completion of the original restriction period (typically, three years from the date of the original grant).
Recipients of Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc. stock rights awarded on January&nbsp;31, 2007, will not receive restricted stock or stock rights of Kraft. Rather, they will receive additional stock rights
of Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc. to preserve the intrinsic value of the original award. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;To
the extent that employees of the remaining Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc. receive Kraft stock options, Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc. will reimburse the Company in cash for the Black-Scholes
fair value of the stock options to be received. To the extent that Kraft employees hold Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc. stock options, the Company will reimburse Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc. in cash for the
Black-Scholes fair value of the stock options. To the extent that holders of Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc. stock rights receive Kraft stock rights, Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc. will pay to the Company the
fair value of the Kraft stock rights less the value of projected forfeitures. Based upon the number of Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc. stock awards outstanding at December&nbsp;31, 2006, the net amount of
these reimbursements would be a payment of approximately $133&nbsp;million from the Company to Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc. Based upon the number of Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc. stock awards outstanding
at December&nbsp;31, 2006, the Company would have to issue 28&nbsp;million stock options and 3&nbsp;million shares of restricted stock and stock rights. The Company estimates that the issuance
of these awards would result in an approximate $0.02 decrease in diluted earnings per share. However, these estimates are subject to change as stock awards vest (in the case of restricted stock) or
are exercised (in the case of stock options) prior to the record date for the distribution. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Other Matters:  </I></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As previously mentioned in Note&nbsp;2. </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Summary of Significant Accounting Policies</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the Company is currently
included in the Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc. consolidated federal income tax return, and federal income tax contingencies are recorded as liabilities on the balance sheet of Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc.
Prior to the distribution of Kraft shares, Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc. will reimburse the Company in cash for these liabilities, which are approximately $300&nbsp;million, plus interest. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
previously mentioned in Note&nbsp;4. </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Related Party Transactions</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, a subsidiary of Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc. currently provides the
Company with certain services at cost plus a 5% management fee. After the Distribution Date, the Company will undertake these activities, and services provided by a subsidiary of Altria
Group,&nbsp;Inc. will cease in 2007. All intercompany accounts will be settled in cash. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ei4185_item_9._changes_in_and_disagre__ite03557"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ei4185_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Item&nbsp;9.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Changes in and Disagreements with Accountants on Accounting and Financial Disclosure.    <BR>    </I></B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;None. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ei4185_item_9a._controls_and_procedures."> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ei4185_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Item&nbsp;9A.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Controls and Procedures.    <BR>    </I></B></FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Disclosure
Controls and Procedures </FONT></DD></DL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Company carried out an evaluation, with the participation of the Company's management, including the Company's Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer, of the
effectiveness of the Company's disclosure controls and procedures (pursuant to Rule&nbsp;13a-15(e) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended) as of the end of the period
covered by this report. Based upon that </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>97</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=9,SEQ=98,EFW="2176027",CP="KRAFT FOODS INC",DN="1",CHK=445540,FOLIO='97',FILE='DISK124:[07ZAA5.07ZAA4185]EI4185A.;36',USER='FSTREET',CD='28-FEB-2007;19:25' -->
<A NAME="page_ei4185_1_98"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>evaluation,
the Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer concluded that the Company's disclosure controls and procedures are effective. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Changes
in Internal Control Over Financial Reporting. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Company's management evaluated, with the participation of the Company's Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer, any change in the Company's internal control over
financial reporting and determined that there has been no change in the Company's internal control over financial reporting during the quarter ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 that has materially
affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the Company's internal control over financial reporting. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;However,
as noted within Item 4 of the Company's quarterly report on Form 10-Q for the period ended September&nbsp;30, 2006, the Company entered into a seven-year agreement in April
2006 to receive information technology services from Electronic Data Systems ("EDS"). Pursuant to this agreement, the Company began to transition certain of its processes and procedures into the EDS
control environment during the quarter ended September 30, 2006. As the Company migrates to the EDS environment, management ensures that key controls are mapped to applicable EDS controls, tests
transition controls prior to the migration date of those controls, and as appropriate, maintains and evaluates controls over the flow of information to and from EDS. The Company expects this
transition period to continue for three years. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;See
also "Report of Management on Internal Control over Financial Reporting" in Item&nbsp;8. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;None. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All
of the above-named officers have been employed by the Company in various capacities during the past five years, except for Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld, Mr.&nbsp;Firestone, Ms.&nbsp;May,
and Mr.&nbsp;Khosla. Prior to being appointed Chief Executive Officer of the Company on June&nbsp;26, 2006, Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld was Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of
Frito-Lay,&nbsp;Inc., a division of PepsiCo, from September&nbsp;2004 to June&nbsp;2006. Prior to joining Frito-Lay,&nbsp;Inc. Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld worked for more than
20&nbsp;years at the Company, holding a number of key management positions, including President of the Company's North American business. Prior to joining the Company in 2003, Mr.&nbsp;Firestone
was Senior Vice President and General Counsel for Philip Morris International&nbsp;Inc. From 1998 until 2001, he was Chief Counsel for Philip Morris Europe. Each of Philip Morris International Inc.
and Philip Morris Europe is an affiliate of the Company insomuch that each of the Company, Philip Morris International Inc. and Philip Morris Europe is under common control of Altria. Prior to joining
the Company in 2005, Ms.&nbsp;May held various positions with Baxter International,&nbsp;Inc. From 2001 to 2005, she was Corporate Vice President of Human Resources. Prior to joining the Company
in 2007, Mr.&nbsp;Khosla served as Managing Director of Fonterra Co-operative Group. Before joining Fonterra in 2004, Khosla spent 27&nbsp;years with Unilever in India, London and
Europe. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Company has adopted a code of ethics as defined in Item 406 of Regulation&nbsp;S-K, which code applies to all of its employees, including its principal executive
officer, principal financial officer, principal accounting officer or controller, and persons performing similar functions. This code of ethics, which is entitled The Kraft Foods Code of Conduct for
Compliance and Integrity, is available free of charge on the Company's website at www.kraft.com and will be provided free of charge to any stockholder requesting a copy by writing to: Corporate
Secretary, Kraft Foods&nbsp;Inc., Three Lakes Drive, Northfield, IL 60093. Any waiver granted by the Company to its principal executive officer, principal financial officer, principal accounting
officer or controller under the code of ethics, or certain amendments to the code of ethics, will be disclosed on the Company's website at www.kraft.com. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>99</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=100,EFW="2176027",CP="KRAFT FOODS INC",DN="1",CHK=38733,FOLIO='99',FILE='DISK124:[07ZAA5.07ZAA4185]EK4185A.;14',USER='FSTREET',CD='28-FEB-2007;18:56' -->
<A NAME="page_ek4185_1_100"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
addition, the Company has adopted corporate governance guidelines and charters for its Audit Committee, Compensation Committee and Nominating and Governance Committee, as well as a
code of business conduct and ethics that applies to the members of its Board of Directors. All of these materials are available on the Company's website at www.kraft.com and will be provided free of
charge to any stockholder requesting a copy by writing to: Corporate Secretary, Kraft Foods&nbsp;Inc., Three Lakes Drive, Northfield, IL 60093. Certain of these materials may also be found in the
proxy statement relating to the Company's 2007 Annual Meeting of Stockholders. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
information on the Company's website is not, and shall not be deemed to be, a part of this Report or incorporated into any other filings the Company makes with the SEC. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
May&nbsp;8, 2006, the Company filed its Annual CEO Certification as required by Section&nbsp;303A.12 of the New York Stock Exchange Listed Company Manual. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;See
also Item 11 for certain information that is incorporated by reference into this Item 10. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ek4185_item_11._executive_compensation."> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ek4185_3"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Item 11.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Executive Compensation.    <BR>    </I></B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except for the information relating to the executive officers of, and certain documents adopted by, the Company set forth in Item 10 of this Report and the
information regarding equity compensation plans set forth in Item 12 below, the information called for by Items 10-14 is hereby incorporated by reference to the Company's definitive proxy
statement for use in connection with its
annual meeting of stockholders to be held on April&nbsp;24, 2007, filed with the SEC in March&nbsp;2007, and, except as indicated therein, is made a part hereof. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ek4185_item_12._security_ownership_of__ite03985"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ek4185_4"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Item 12.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Security Ownership of Certain Beneficial Owners and Management and Related Stockholder Matters.    <BR>    </I></B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The number of shares to be issued upon exercise or vesting of awards issued under, and the number of shares remaining available for future issuance under, the
Company's equity compensation plans at December&nbsp;31, 2006 were as follows: </FONT></P>

<A NAME="toc_ji4185_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>REPORT OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM<BR>  ON FINANCIAL STATEMENT SCHEDULE    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>To
the Board of Directors and Shareholders of Kraft Foods&nbsp;Inc.: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
audits of the consolidated financial statements, of management's assessment of the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting and of the effectiveness of internal
control over financial reporting referred to in our report dated February&nbsp;5, 2007 appearing in this Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K of Kraft Foods&nbsp;Inc. also included an
audit of the financial statement schedule listed in Item 15(a) of this Form&nbsp;10-K. In our opinion, this financial statement schedule presents fairly, in all material respects, the
information set forth therein when read in conjunction with the related consolidated financial statements. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>/s/
</FONT><FONT SIZE=2>PRICEWATERHOUSECOOPERS LLP</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Chicago,
Illinois<BR>
February&nbsp;5, 2007 </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Notes:</B></FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Primarily
related to divestitures, acquisitions and currency translation.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Represents
charges for which allowances were created. </FONT></DD></DL>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A

<A NAME="toc_ke4185_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>CONSENT OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We hereby consent to the incorporation by reference in the Registration Statements on Form&nbsp;S-8 (Nos. 333-71266,
333-84616, 333-125992, 333-133559 and 333-137021) and on Form&nbsp;S-3 (File Nos. 333-67770, 333-86478,
333-101829 and 333-113620), of Kraft Foods&nbsp;Inc., of our reports dated February&nbsp;5, 2007 relating to the consolidated financial statements, management's assessment
of the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting and the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting and financial statement schedule, which appear in this Annual
Report on Form&nbsp;10-K. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>EXHIBIT 24  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kg4185_power_of_attorney"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kg4185_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>POWER OF ATTORNEY    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;KNOW ALL MEN BY THESE PRESENT THAT the undersigned, a Director of Kraft Foods&nbsp;Inc., a Virginia corporation (the "Company"), does hereby constitute and
appoint Louis C. Camilleri, Marc S. Firestone and James P. Dollive, or any one or more of them, his true and lawful attorney, for him and in his name, place and stead, to execute, by manual or
facsimile signature, electronic transmission or otherwise, the Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K of the Company for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 and any amendments or
supplements to said Annual Report and to cause the same to be filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission, together with any exhibits, financial statements and schedules included or to be
incorporated by reference therein, hereby granting to said attorneys full power and authority to do and perform all and every act and thing whatsoever requisite or desirable to be done in and about
the premises as fully to all intents and purposes as the undersigned might or could do in person, hereby ratifying and confirming all acts and things which said attorneys may do or cause to be done by
virtue of these present. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN
WITNESS WHEREOF, the undersigned has hereunto set his hand and seal this 29th day of January, 2007. </FONT></P>

supplements to said Annual Report and to cause the same to be filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission, together with any exhibits, financial statements and schedules included or to be

the premises as fully to all intents and purposes as the undersigned might or could do in person, hereby ratifying and confirming all acts and things which said attorneys may do or cause to be done by
virtue of these present. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN
WITNESS WHEREOF, the undersigned has hereunto set his hand and seal this 29th day of January, 2007. </FONT></P>

<TYPE>EX-31.1
<SEQUENCE>6
<FILENAME>a2176027zex-31_1.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EX-31.1
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#07ZAA4185_6">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>EXHIBIT 31.1  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ki4185_certifications"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ki4185_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Certifications    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>I,
Irene B. Rosenfeld, certify that: </FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>I
have reviewed this annual report on Form&nbsp;10-K of Kraft Foods&nbsp;Inc.;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Based
on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the
circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Based
on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of
operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
registrant's other certifying officer and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act
Rules&nbsp;13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f))
for the registrant and have:
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Designed
such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating
to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Designed
such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance
regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Evaluated
the effectiveness of the registrant's disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and
procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(d)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Disclosed
in this report any change in the registrant's internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant's most recent fiscal quarter (the registrant's
fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant's internal control over financial reporting; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD></DL>
</DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>5.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
registrant's other certifying officer and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant's auditors and the
audit committee of the registrant's board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>All
significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the
registrant's ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Any
fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant's internal control over financial reporting. </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>

<TR VALIGN="TOP">

<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>EXHIBIT 32.1  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="km4185_certification_pursuant_to_18_u__cer03819"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_km4185_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>CERTIFICATION PURSUANT TO<BR>  18 U.S.C. SECTION 1350,<BR>  AS ADOPTED PURSUANT TO<BR>  SECTION 906 OF THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In connection with the Annual Report of Kraft Foods&nbsp;Inc. (the "Company") on Form&nbsp;10-K for the period ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 as
filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on the date hereof (the "Report"), I, Irene B. Rosenfeld, Chief Executive Officer of the Company, certify, pursuant to 18 U.S.C. &sect; 1350,
as adopted pursuant to &sect; 906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, that: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(1)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the
Report fully complies with the requirements of section&nbsp;13(a) or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934; and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(2)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the
information contained in the Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of the Company. </FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="40%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
/s/&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2>IRENE B. ROSENFELD</FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><HR NOSHADE><FONT SIZE=2> Irene B. Rosenfeld<BR>
Chief Executive Officer<BR>
March&nbsp;1, 2007</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="58%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>A signed original of this written statement required by Section&nbsp;906, or other document authenticating, acknowledging, or otherwise
adopting the signature that appears in typed form within the electronic version of this written statement required by Section&nbsp;906, has been provided to Kraft Foods&nbsp;Inc. and will be
retained by Kraft Foods&nbsp;Inc. and furnished to the Securities and Exchange Commission or its staff upon request.</I></FONT></P>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-32.2
<SEQUENCE>9
<FILENAME>a2176027zex-32_2.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EX-32.2
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#07ZAA4185_9">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>EXHIBIT 32.2  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ko4185_certification_pursuant_to_18_u__cer03819"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ko4185_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>CERTIFICATION PURSUANT TO<BR>  18 U.S.C. SECTION 1350,<BR>  AS ADOPTED PURSUANT TO<BR>  SECTION 906 OF THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In connection with the Annual Report of Kraft Foods&nbsp;Inc. (the "Company") on Form&nbsp;10-K for the period ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 as
filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on the date hereof (the "Report"), I, James P. Dollive, Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of the Company, certify, pursuant to 18
U.S.C. &sect; 1350, as adopted pursuant to &sect; 906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, that: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(1)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the
Report fully complies with the requirements of section&nbsp;13(a) or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934; and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(2)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the
information contained in the Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of the Company. </FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="40%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
/s/&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2>JAMES P. DOLLIVE</FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><HR NOSHADE><FONT SIZE=2> James P. Dollive<BR>
Executive Vice President and<BR>
Chief Financial Officer<BR>
March&nbsp;1, 2007</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="58%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>A signed original of this written statement required by Section&nbsp;906, or other document authenticating, acknowledging, or otherwise
adopting the signature that appears in typed form within the electronic version of this written statement required by Section&nbsp;906, has been provided to Kraft Foods&nbsp;Inc. and will be
retained by Kraft Foods&nbsp;Inc. and furnished to the Securities and Exchange Commission or its staff upon request.</I></FONT></P>
